page.title: 01Ashbourne Gazetteer.
page.content: {Ashbourne}is a small, rural, market town lying just outside the southern tip of the {Peak District National {Park.}This position gives the town important income from{tourism}and accounts for the slogan{"Gateway to {Dovedale"}on road signs and tourist materials. In recent years the town has increased its{industrial base} with the development of the old airfield as an industrial estate. Industry in the surrounding area provides extra employment, particularly{quarry-related business.} There are numerous small firms operating lorries on contractual work to the quarries and to farmers carrying bulk loads. This is a contributory factor to the town's {traffic problem}and continual debate about the need for a ring road.
